title: San Francisco Municipal Natural Gas Equipment Inventory
description: A. SUMMARY The Municipal Natural Gas Equipment Inventory serves to catalog natural gas-fueled equipment used in municipally owned buildings. This inventory, implemented by the SF Environment Department, aims to establish an understanding of the scope of work needed to electrify municipal buildings and inform an effective and collaborative planning process. This effort was identified as an action in Section BO-2.4 of the 2021 Climate Action Plan and is included in the Environment Code Chapter 7 (Municipal Green Building Requirements). B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED The list of buildings required to report data for the Municipal Natural Gas Equipment Inventory was compiled by cross-referencing the Cityâ€™s Facility Systems of Record and the 2020 municipal benchmarking report to identify all city-owned buildings with non-zero carbon emissions. Numerous municipal buildings are exempt from these reporting requirements, including facilities of the Port of San Francisco and buildings with a primary purpose of providing collection, storage, treatment, delivery, distribution, and/or transmission of water, wastewater, and/or power utilities. Each department received an inventory template, provided by the Environment Department, to submit high level building data and detailed information on each piece of natural gas equipment in use in these buildings. Departments were asked to self-report the required building and equipment data over the course of a 6-month data collection period in 2023 and are asked to keep this inventory up to date in the following years as equipment is replaced. C. UPDATE PROCESS The inventory will be regularly updated by department representatives via the inventory PowerApp. When a gas-powered equipment item is retired or replaced, departments are asked to mark it as no longer in use and provide information on any electric replacement equipment, if applicable. While departments have the flexibility to update the inventory at any time, they are encouraged to do so at 6 month intervals at the minimum. Updated inventory data will be automatically reflected in this dataset. D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET It is important to note that this dataset does not include facilities of the Port of San Francisco and buildings with a primary purpose of providing collection, storage, treatment, delivery, distribution, and/or transmission of water, wastewater, and/or power utilities, in accordance with Environment Code Chapter 7 exemptions.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each equipment item in the dataset

columns.name: department
columns.description: Name of department equipment item is in

columns.name: building_name
columns.description: Name of building equipment item is in

columns.name: building_address
columns.description: Address of building equipment item is in

columns.name: fsr_id
columns.description: Identification number for the building, as provided in the Facility System of Record

columns.name: equipment_function
columns.description: General function of the equipment item - This is a standardized column (options include: Space conditioning, water heating, cooking, clothes drying, other)

columns.name: equipment_type
columns.description: Specific type of equipment item -  This is a standardized column (options include: Charbroiler, Combi-oven, Cooktop, Fryer, Griddle, Pizza oven, Range, Rice cooker, Rotisserie, Wok, Air Handling Unit (direct gas-fired), Furnace, Space Heating Boiler, Unit Heater, Pool Heater, Tankless Water Heater, Tank Water Heater, Other)

columns.name: manufacturer
columns.description: Name of manufacturer of equipment item

columns.name: model
columns.description: Name of model of equipment item

columns.name: install_year
columns.description: Date the equipment item was installed

columns.name: input_capacity
columns.description: Equipment item input capacity in MBH (1,000 BTUs/hour)

columns.name: output_capacity
columns.description: Equipment item output capacity in MBH (1,000 BTUs/hour)

columns.name: nameplate_efficiency
columns.description: A measure of how effectively a system converts energy input (fuel) into useful output

columns.name: refrigerant_type
columns.description: Type of refrigerant used in equipment item

columns.name: hours_of_use
columns.description: The number of hours the equipment item is in use each day

columns.name: parcel_number
columns.description: Parcel number of building equipment item is in

columns.name: point
columns.description: Point derived from parcel centroid

columns.name: latitude
columns.description: Latitude of parcel centroid

columns.name: longitude
columns.description: Longitude of parcel centroid

columns.name: analysis_neighborhood
columns.description: Analysis neighborhood based on parcel centroid

columns.name: supervisor_district
columns.description: Supervisor district based on parcel centroid

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was last updated in the source system

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was uploaded to the open data portal
